            Bio
            I am a bit of a generalist with experience spanning molecular ecology, to avian ecology, to plant sciences, to aquatic ecology. However, I could best be described as a community ecologist with an interest in computational ecology, community assembly, and the quantitative methods we use to detect patterns of association within ecological communities. In my spare time I am an unskilled but enthusiastic mountain biker, trout fisher person, and mushroom hunter. My happy places all involve the outdoors with back country canoe camping, swimming, and snowshoeing being some of the things I can’t get enough of.
            
            
            Education
            Queen’s University | Kingston, ON CANADA
            Ph.D. in Biology | September 2014 – October 2021
            
            University of Saskatchewan | Saskatoon, SK CANADA
            M.Sc. in Biology | January 2012 – September 2014
            
            Brock University | St. Catherines, ON CANADA
            B.Sc. in Biology | September 1993 – April 1998
            
            
            
            Teaching Experience
            Post Doctoral Fellow
            January 2022 - Present | University of Regina
            Kerri Finlay’s Lab (FAST) & CIEE Living Data Project
            
            Graduate courses
            2021 Assistant Professor | Queen’s University
            Introduction to Statistics
            
            Undergraduate courses
            Summer 2022 | Teaching fellow | Queen’s University
            Introduction to Statistics
            
            Winter 2022 | Teaching fellow | Queen’s University
            Introduction to Statistics
            
            Summer 2021 Teaching fellow | Queen’s University
            Introduction to Statistics
            
            Fall 2020 Teaching fellow | Queen’s University
            Data Analysis for Biologists
            
            Summer 2020 Teaching fellow | Queen’s University
            Introduction to Statistics
